study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether DHA/ARA-supplemented formula during infancy reduces the incidence of allergic and respiratory diseases by age 3 years.
results_summary: The DHA/ARA group had significantly lower odds of developing upper respiratory infections, wheezing/asthma, and allergic diseases, with delayed onset of these conditions compared to the control group.
population_specificity: Infants fed DHA/ARA-supplemented or control formula during their first year of life, followed up to age 3 years.
effective_dosage: 0.32%-0.36% DHA and 0.64%-0.72% ARA of total fatty acids in the supplemented formula.
study_duration: First year of life (intervention), with follow-up to age 3 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the neuroprotective potential of docosahexaenoic acid (DHA) in preventing Alzheimer's disease (AD) and preserving synaptic function and memory capacities.
results_summary: The study found that DHA supplementation has beneficial effects on cognition and synaptic integrity in various AD models, preserving neuronal and brain functions through multiple molecular and cellular mechanisms. DHA deficiency was identified as a risk factor for AD, while its supplementation showed potential in preventing AD and other lipid- and age-related diseases.
population_specificity: Aged individuals and Alzheimer's disease models.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether docosahexaenoic acid (DHA) and other n-3 PUFAs could prevent or treat immunoglobulin A nephropathy (IgAN) and lupus nephritis by modulating inflammatory and immune responses.
results_summary: The study found that n-3 PUFAs, including DHA, suppressed inflammatory processes, reduced aberrant IgA production and immune complex deposition in IgAN models, and decreased anti-double-stranded DNA IgG antibodies in lupus nephritis models. Clinical trials showed mixed results, with some supporting n-3 PUFA efficacy while others found no benefit.
population_specificity: Pre-clinical mouse models (IgAN and lupus nephritis) and human clinical trials (IgAN and lupus nephritis patients).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of docosahexaenoic acid (DHA) in slowing the pathogenesis of Alzheimer's disease and vascular dementia, focusing on its pleiotropic mechanisms and clinical efficacy.
results_summary: DHA appears to slow Alzheimer's disease progression by reducing beta-amyloid peptide production, moderating tau-protein hyperphosphorylation, and addressing neuroinflammation and oxidative damage. Clinical trials suggest DHA may slow early-stage progression, though effects may depend on apolipoprotein E genotype.
population_specificity: Elderly individuals at risk for or in early stages of Alzheimer's disease or vascular dementia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of docosahexaenoic acid (DHA) supplementation, alone and combined with vitamins, on oxidative stress and antioxidant status in trained cyclists during prolonged exercise.
results_summary: Supplementation with DHA increased plasma levels of DHA but also elevated F2-isoprostanes (a marker of oxidative stress) post-exercise. Combining DHA with antioxidants modestly attenuated but did not prevent this increase in oxidative stress.
population_specificity: 48 trained cyclists
effective_dosage: 400 mg of DHA daily (combined with 2000 mg of EPA)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of docosahexaenoic acid (DHA) in infant growth and development, focusing on supplementation effects in preterm and term infants, as well as during pregnancy and lactation.
results_summary: The study found no harm from DHA supplementation in infants, whether preterm or term, with developmental benefits more consistently observed in preterm infants. This is attributed to preterm infants missing the full gestation period for DHA accumulation, making supplementation particularly beneficial for them.
population_specificity: Preterm and term infants, as well as pregnant and lactating women.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether oral supplementation of docosahexaenoic acid (DHA) improves the fatty acid profile of erythrocyte membrane phospholipids in patients with maldigestion and/or malabsorption.
results_summary: Supplementation with DHA significantly increased its concentration in erythrocyte membrane phospholipids (1.419%) compared to the control group (0.151%). The study also noted a decrease in serum GGT activity, suggesting reduced oxidative stress.
population_specificity: 48 patients with gastrointestinal diseases (maldigestion and/or malabsorption).
effective_dosage: Not specified (combined with ALA and medium-chain triglycerides in FA-ADEK group).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the relationship between maternal DHA intake during pregnancy and infant developmental outcomes, as well as the effectiveness of DHA supplementation in improving neurofunctional and visual performance.
results_summary: High-dosage DHA supplementation during pregnancy was associated with long-term positive effects on infant neurodevelopment, particularly intelligence quotient scores. DHA enrichment of human milk was effective when supplementation began during pregnancy, while results in artificially fed infants were inconsistent, possibly due to uninvestigated covariates.
population_specificity: Pregnant women, lactating mothers, and infants (both breastfed and artificially fed).
study_duration: Supplementation started at mid-pregnancy and continued into lactation; complementary feeding period for infants.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of DHA supplementation on functional cortical activity during sustained attention in healthy boys.
results_summary: DHA supplementation significantly increased erythrocyte membrane DHA composition and altered cortical activation patterns during sustained attention, with dose-dependent effects observed in the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex, occipital cortex, and cerebellar cortex. Higher DHA levels correlated with improved dorsolateral prefrontal cortex activation and faster reaction times.
population_specificity: Healthy boys aged 8-10 years (n = 33)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether plasma LPA is produced via LPC hydrolysis by autotaxin and how EPA/DHA supplementation affects LPC and LPA species.
results_summary: EPA/DHA supplementation significantly increased EPA-LPC and DHA-LPC concentrations but did not affect EPA- or DHA-LPA levels or autotaxin activity. The findings challenge the model of LPA generation via LPC hydrolysis.
population_specificity: Normal volunteers

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if omega-3 supplementation (including docosahexaenoic acid) could reduce preterm birth in women with a history of spontaneous preterm birth who were already receiving 17alpha-hydroxyprogesterone caproate.
results_summary: The study found no significant benefit of omega-3 supplementation in reducing preterm birth, with delivery before 37 weeks occurring in 37.8% of the omega-3 group and 41.6% of the placebo group (relative risk 0.91, 95% CI 0.77-1.07).
population_specificity: Women with a history of prior spontaneous singleton preterm birth and a current singleton gestation.
effective_dosage: 1,200 mg eicosapentaenoic acid and 800 mg docosahexaenoic acid daily.
study_duration: From 16-22 weeks through 36 weeks of gestation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of omega-3 supplementation (containing DHA and EPA) on cognitive and behavioral outcomes in typically developing children.
results_summary: The study found significant changes in omega-6 to omega-3 ratios in the active group, but only three significant differences in cognitive and behavioral outcomes, one favoring the placebo. Associations between fatty acid changes and test/questionnaire scores were inconclusive.
population_specificity: 450 typically developing children aged 8-10 years from a mainstream school population.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether 900mg/d algal DHA supplementation could improve cognitive function and cardiovascular health in older adults with age-related cognitive decline (ARCD).
results_summary: The study found that algal DHA supplementation significantly reduced errors in cognitive tasks (CANTAB Paired Associate Learning), improved verbal recognition memory, and decreased resting heart rate after six months compared to placebo. These results suggest DHA may help prevent or mitigate cognitive decline and cardiovascular issues in aging populations.
population_specificity: Older adults with age-related cognitive decline (ARCD) (n=485).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of EPA and DHA on postprandial vascular function in subjects with type 2 diabetes mellitus.
results_summary: The study found that 6 weeks of n-3 FA supplementation reduced the postprandial decrease in macrovascular function and improved postprandial microvascular function compared to placebo.
population_specificity: Subjects with type 2 diabetes mellitus (n=34).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of docosahexaenoic acid (DHA) in maintaining cognitive function in aging individuals and its potential effects on Alzheimer's disease and vascular dementia.
results_summary: The study found that DHA and other omega-3 fatty acids have beneficial effects on neuronal functioning, inflammation, and cognitive decline, with positive effects observed in cognitively intact or mildly impaired older adults but little effect in Alzheimer's patients. Large, long-term trials are needed for conclusive evidence.
population_specificity: Older adults, including those who were cognitively intact, had mild cognitive impairment, or had Alzheimer's disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether feeding preterm infants milk with higher DHA content than standard practice influences language or behavior in early childhood.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in language development, behavior, or temperament between preterm infants fed higher-DHA milk and the control group. The higher DHA dosage did not result in clinically meaningful changes in early childhood outcomes.
population_specificity: Preterm infants born at <33 weeks of gestation.
effective_dosage: Higher-DHA group: 1% of total fatty acids as DHA; control group: ~0.3% DHA.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the relationship between docosahexaenoic acid (DHA) supplementation during pregnancy and lactation and infant general movement (GM) quality, focusing on erythrocyte fatty acid levels.
results_summary: DHA supplementation was associated with more mildly abnormal general movements in infants, with GM quality inversely related to arachidonic acid (AA) and associated with Mead acid and DHA/AA in a U-shaped manner, suggesting potential AA synthesis restriction and varying developmental trajectories.
population_specificity: Infants of mothers who received DHA supplementation during pregnancy and lactation (n=57).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate how apolipoprotein E (apoE) genotype influences the response of plasma lipoprotein profiles to docosahexaenoic acid (DHA) intervention compared to eicosapentaenoic acid (EPA) in humans.
results_summary: The study found a genotype-independent reduction in plasma triglycerides with DHA, but a differential response in total cholesterol and LDL-C in E4 carriers, with DHA increasing LDL-C in this subgroup. Competitive uptake studies suggested DHA-treated VLDL(2) from E3/E4 individuals reduced LDL uptake in HepG2 cells.
population_specificity: 38 healthy normolipidaemic males (20 E3/E3 and 18 E3/E4 genotypes).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if Dong Quai effectively reduces hot flashes in prostate cancer patients undergoing androgen deprivation therapy.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in the severity, frequency, or duration of hot flashes between the Dong Quai and placebo groups. Disease progression was not observed in any patient.
population_specificity: 22 men with prostate cancer receiving luteinizing hormone-releasing hormone agonist therapy and experiencing bothersome hot flashes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of marine phospholipids, rich in docosahexaenoic acid, on weight stabilization, appetite, and quality of life in cancer patients experiencing weight loss.
results_summary: The study found that low-dose marine phospholipid supplementation significantly increased docosahexaenoic acid levels in plasma phospholipids, stabilized body weight, and improved appetite and quality of life in cancer patients.
population_specificity: Thirty-one tumor patients with various tumor entities suffering from weight loss (17 analyzed).
effective_dosage: 1.5 g/day of marine phospholipids as softgel capsules.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether dietary supplementation with docosahexaenoic acid (DHA) could improve breast cancer treatment efficacy and outcomes by sensitizing tumor cells to therapy and preventing metastatic regrowth.
results_summary: The study found that DHA has potential to enhance breast cancer treatment efficacy without additional side effects, particularly in sensitizing residual tumor cells to chemotherapy and radiation therapy. It also suggested that prolonged supplementation with rumenic acid could help prevent metastatic regrowth.
population_specificity: Breast cancer patients (clinical and preclinical studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate potential interactions between Dong Quai and warfarin, as well as its effects on coagulation parameters.
results_summary: The study found that Dong Quai caused a significant elevation in prothrombin time and international normalized ratio in a patient stabilized on warfarin, suggesting a pharmacodynamic interaction. The patient's coagulation values normalized after discontinuing Dong Quai.
population_specificity: A 46-year-old African-American woman with atrial fibrillation on warfarin therapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of Dong Quai water extract on the proliferation of estrogen receptor-positive (MCF-7) and negative (BT-20) breast cancer cells in vitro.
results_summary: The Dong Quai extract dose-dependently stimulated the proliferation of MCF-7 cells with weak estrogen-agonistic activity and also augmented BT-20 cell growth independently of estrogen receptors. The study suggests caution in using Dong Quai for peri- or postmenopausal symptoms, especially in women with breast cancer.
population_specificity: In vitro breast cancer cell lines (MCF-7 and BT-20).

study_goal: To evaluate whether Dong Quai produces estrogen-like effects on vaginal cells and endometrial thickness and alleviates menopausal symptoms in postmenopausal women.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences between Dong Quai and placebo in endometrial thickness, vaginal cell maturation, or relief of menopausal symptoms. Dong Quai did not demonstrate estrogen-like effects or symptom improvement compared to placebo.
population_specificity: Seventy-one postmenopausal women (mean age 52.4 ± 6 years) with hot flashes and elevated follicle-stimulating hormone levels.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify morning glory syndrome, an optic disc anomaly, and its association with pituitary dwarfism in two patients.
results_summary: The study reported two cases of morning glory syndrome linked to pituitary dwarfism, with one case involving pituitary gland compression by a basal encephalocele and the other with unidentified causative factors. The authors concluded that patients with morning glory syndrome should undergo thorough physical and growth evaluations for early detection and treatment of pituitary dwarfism.
population_specificity: Two patients with morning glory syndrome and associated pituitary dwarfism.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the anticancer activity of ECa 233, focusing on its effects on cell viability, apoptosis, migration, invasion, and pharmacokinetics in oral cancer cells.
results_summary: ECa 233 reduced KON cell viability, induced apoptosis, arrested the cell cycle in the G0/G1 phase, and decreased migration and invasion abilities. It also increased TEER values, reducing colony and spheroid formations.
population_specificity: KON cells (oral cancer cell line)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of a single stop-flow balloon-assisted embolization technique using Onyx 18 in treating stage IV juvenile nasopharyngeal angiofibroma (JNA).
results_summary: The study found that the embolization technique using Onyx 18 was safe, effective, and a definitive approach for treating stage IV JNA, with no reported complications.
population_specificity: Young boys with stage IV juvenile nasopharyngeal angiofibroma (JNA).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the performance of two classification models (Stacking-ensemble and ECA-EfficientNetV2) for detecting multiple chest diseases, including COVID-19, using chest X-ray and CT images.
results_summary: The ECA-EfficientNetV2 model achieved the highest performance metrics (Accuracy, Precision, Recall, F1-score, and AUC) on both chest X-ray and CT datasets, with results exceeding 99% across all metrics. The Stacking-ensemble model also performed well, though slightly less effectively than ECA-EfficientNetV2.
population_specificity: Chest X-ray and CT images from datasets including COVID-19 cases.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to measure the extent and impact of psychiatric comorbidity in a cohort of the Baltimore Epidemiologic Catchment Area study, focusing on 16 mental disorders.
results_summary: The study found that anxiety disorders were highly interrelated and comorbid with depression, while mood disorders showed high comorbidity with Alcohol Dependence. Obsessive Compulsive Disorder had a comorbidity burden 89% greater than the overall sample.
population_specificity: 847 participants from the Baltimore Epidemiologic Catchment Area study.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of ECa 233 on mechanical hyperalgesia and allodynia induced by chronic constriction injury of the infraorbital nerve in mice.
results_summary: ECa 233 (100 and 300 mg/kg) mitigated hyperalgesia and allodynia-like behavior and reduced P2X3 upregulation and nociceptive activity, though it did not affect NaV1.7 protein expression. The effects were comparable to carbamazepine, suggesting ECa 233 as a potential alternative for trigeminal pain management.
population_specificity: Mice with chronic constriction injury of the infraorbital nerve.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the anti-nociceptive effects of ECa 233 and its synergistic effect with gabapentin on chronic neuropathic orofacial pain in mice.
results_summary: ECa 233 (300 mg/kg) and gabapentin (10 mg/kg) attenuated mechanical hyperalgesia and allodynia, downregulated calcitonin gene-related peptide in the trigeminal ganglion, and reduced c-fos expression in the trigeminal nucleus caudalis.
population_specificity: Mice with chronic neuropathic orofacial pain induced by infraorbital nerve chronic constriction injury.
effective_dosage: 30, 100, and 300 mg/kg ECa 233; 10 mg/kg gabapentin (oral gavage).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the structure and antitumor activity of polysaccharides from Atractylodes macrocephala Koidz (APA) in vitro, specifically against esophageal cancer cells (Eca109).
results_summary: APA demonstrated a 74.63% proliferation inhibition in Eca109 cells at 2 mg/mL, inducing apoptosis via the mitochondrial pathway and arresting cells in the S phase. Structural analysis confirmed APA as a 2.1KDa neutral heteropolysaccharide composed of arabinose and glucose.
population_specificity: In vitro study using Eca109 esophageal cancer cells.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the prognosis and outcome of prenatally diagnosed atrioventricular septal defect (AVSD) based on classification, including coexisting extracardiac abnormalities (ECA) and malformations (ECM), and their influence on prenatal consultation.
results_summary: The study found that AVSD with coexisting ECM was associated with higher mortality, shorter gestation, lower Apgar scores, and more premature deliveries, while AVSD with ECA was linked to increased nuchal translucency and abnormal karyotype, particularly trisomy 21.
population_specificity: 72 fetuses with isolated AVSD (6 with simple AVSD, 28 with AVSD + ECA, 38 with AVSD + ECM).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects and possible mechanisms of DVDMs-mediated photodynamic therapy (PDT) on human esophageal cancer Eca-109 cells.
results_summary: DVDMs-PDT reduced cell viability, induced apoptosis and autophagy, and generated ROS in Eca-109 cells. ROS activation led to p38MAPK and JNK activation, which may be involved in PDT-induced apoptosis.
population_specificity: Human esophageal cancer Eca-109 cells (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the radiosensitizing effect of liriodenine on ECA-109 cells and investigate its underlying mechanisms in esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (ESCC).
results_summary: Liriodenine dose-dependently inhibited ECA-109 cell viability, increased radiosensitivity, induced apoptosis and G2/M arrest, and delayed DNA damage repair. The upregulation of Bax and Caspase-3 and suppression of Bcl-2 confirmed apoptosis.
population_specificity: Esophageal cancer ECA-109 cell line (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the anti-inflammatory effects and mechanisms of ECa 233 in LPS-stimulated RAW264.7 macrophages.
results_summary: ECa 233 significantly inhibited LPS-induced production of pro-inflammatory mediators (ROS, NO, PGE2) and cytokines (TNF-α, IL-1β) without cytotoxicity. It also downregulated iNOS, COX-2, NF-κB, Akt, ERK1/2, and p38 MAPK activation.
population_specificity: RAW264.7 macrophages (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether hesperetin inhibits cell proliferation and invasion in esophageal cancer and enhances the anti-tumor effects of 5-fluorouracil (5-FU).
results_summary: Hesperetin induced cell cycle arrest, inhibited proliferation and invasion, and suppressed PI3K/AKT signaling in Eca-109 cells. Combined with 5-FU, it showed synergistic antitumor effects in vitro and in vivo, increasing apoptosis and modulating apoptotic proteins.
population_specificity: Eca-109 esophageal cancer cells and a xenograft mouse model.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the antitumor effects of water-soluble phenylethanoid glycosides from Cistanche tubulosa (CTPG-W) on esophageal cancer cells (Eca-109).
results_summary: CTPG-W significantly reduced Eca-109 cell viability by inducing apoptosis and cell cycle arrest, mediated through mitochondrial-dependent pathways involving changes in Bcl-2 family proteins, cytochrome c, and caspase activation. Reactive oxygen species levels also showed notable changes.
population_specificity: Esophageal cancer cells (Eca-109) in vitro.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the therapeutic value of autophagy inhibition and its correlation with mitochondria in human esophageal carcinoma cells (Eca‑109) following ionizing radiation (IR) treatment.
results_summary: Autophagy inhibition increased radiosensitivity in Eca‑109 cells, enhancing apoptosis and mitochondrial dysfunction. In vivo, IR combined with autophagy inhibition significantly improved tumor growth delay compared to IR alone.
population_specificity: Human esophageal carcinoma cells (Eca‑109) and nude mouse xenograft models.
effective_dosage: Not specified (EBSS, 3‑Methyladenine, LY294002 used in vitro; IR details not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the motivational and guidance effects of an Embodied Conversational Agent (ECA) versus textual guidance in eHealth users, particularly under stress conditions, and to assess the impact of gender matching between participants and the ECA.
results_summary: The study found that ECA was preferred over text in no-stress conditions but did not outperform text in stress conditions. The visual presence of the ECA may have inhibited distressed users, suggesting that textual guidance can sometimes be equally effective, especially in stressful circumstances.
population_specificity: eHealth users, half of whom were deliberately placed in a stressful pre-condition.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect and underlying molecular mechanisms of ECa 233 on the migration of human keratinocytes (HaCaT cells) to understand its wound-healing potential.
results_summary: ECa 233 significantly enhanced HaCaT cell migration in a concentration- and time-dependent manner, increased filopodia formation, and upregulated Rac1, RhoA, FAK, Akt, ERK, and p38 MAPK signaling pathways, suggesting its role in promoting wound healing.
population_specificity: Human keratinocyte cell line (HaCaT) in vitro.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of Celastrus orbiculatus ethyl acetate extracts (COE) on esophageal squamous carcinoma cells (ESCC), focusing on cell cycle arrest, apoptosis, and mTOR pathway suppression.
results_summary: COE treatment induced G0/G1 cell cycle arrest, DNA damage, and apoptosis in ESCC in a dose-dependent manner. Combined treatment with COE and rapamycin showed synergistic effects compared to either treatment alone.
population_specificity: Esophageal squamous carcinoma cells (ESCC), specifically ECA-109 cells in vitro.
interactions: Synergistic interaction with rapamycin (an mTOR inhibitor) noted.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of gemcitabine (GEM) on differentially expressed proteins and mitochondrial ultrastructure in the human esophageal cancer cell line Eca‑109.
results_summary: GEM significantly inhibited Eca‑109 cell growth in a concentration- and time-dependent manner, with an IC50 of 3.87 µg/ml. It upregulated apoptosis-related proteins (ASC, Bax‑α) and downregulated Mcl‑1, while damaging mitochondrial ultrastructure.
population_specificity: Human esophageal cancer cell line Eca‑109.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of TCF-3 gene knockdown on human esophageal cancer Eca-109 cell proliferation, apoptosis, and cell cycle progression.
results_summary: TCF-3 gene silencing reduced Eca-109 cell viability and proliferation, inhibited cell cycle progression, and increased apoptosis by up-regulating cleaved caspase and Bax while down-regulating Bcl-2.
population_specificity: Human esophageal cancer Eca-109 cells (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of miR-34a on reversing radiation resistance in esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (ESCC) and the underlying mechanism involving SIRT1 and the PI3K/AKT/mTOR pathway.
results_summary: The study found that miR-34a significantly induced cell death and apoptosis in radiation-resistant ESCC cells (rECA-109) and inhibited their migration by downregulating SIRT1 and inhibiting the PI3K/AKT/mTOR pathway. In vivo experiments confirmed that miR-34a reversed radiation resistance in ESCC, with SIRT1 activation enhancing this effect.
population_specificity: Radiation-resistant esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (ESCC) cell line (rECA-109) and xenograft models.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the molecular mechanisms underlying the anticancer activity of an ethyl acetate extract of D. altaica (Da-Ea) in Eca-109 cells, focusing on apoptosis, cell cycle arrest, and PPARγ expression.
results_summary: Da-Ea treatment increased apoptosis, induced S phase cell cycle arrest, and upregulated PPARγ expression in Eca-109 cells, suggesting antiproliferative effects. The main constituents of Da-Ea were identified as daphnetin-7-O-β-D-glucoside, daphnetin, demethyldaphnoretin-7-O-β-D-glucopyranoside, and genkwanol A.
population_specificity: Eca-109 cells (a human esophageal cancer cell line)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the resistance mechanism of 5-FU in esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (ESCC) by establishing and characterizing a 5-FU-resistant cell line (Eca-109/5-FU).
results_summary: The study found that the 5-FU-resistant Eca-109/5-FU cell line exhibited decreased susceptibility to 5-FU, altered drug resistance-related proteins, EMT and cancer stem cell-like properties, and significant metabolic changes compared to the parental Eca-109 cells.
population_specificity: Esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (ESCC) cell line Eca-109 and its 5-FU-resistant derivative Eca-109/5-FU.
effective_dosage: Stepwise exposure to increasing 5-FU concentrations (specific amounts not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of RAD18-siRNA on cell proliferation and chemotherapy sensitivity in esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (ESCC) ECA-109 cells.
results_summary: Down-regulation of RAD18 significantly inhibited cell proliferation, increased G1 phase cells, decreased G2/M phase cells, and enhanced chemo-sensitivity to cisplatin and 5-FU in ECA-109 cells. RAD18 expression was positively correlated with CyclinD1 in ESCC tissues.
population_specificity: Human ECA-109 esophageal squamous cell carcinoma cells.
effective_dosage: Not specified (transfection with RAD18-siRNA via Lipofectamine 3000).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of evodiamine on the radiosensitivity of esophageal squamous cell cancer Eca-109 cells.
results_summary: Evodiamine decreased Eca-109 cell proliferation in a concentration-dependent manner, with maximal inhibition at 80 μg/mL. Combining evodiamine with radiotherapy improved survival curves, reduced D0 and Dq values, and suppressed radiotherapy-induced G2/M arrest and DNA repair protein expressions.
population_specificity: Esophageal squamous cell cancer Eca-109 cells (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a double anastomoses procedure (STA- and OA-MCA) for treating a hemorrhagic twig-like MCA and improving cerebral blood flow.
results_summary: The double anastomoses procedure successfully improved cerebral blood flow and vascular reactivity, with no subsequent cerebrovascular events observed over 7 years. The patient's postoperative course was uneventful, and follow-up imaging showed no evidence of cerebral infarction.
population_specificity: A 55-year-old man with a hemorrhagic twig-like MCA.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether silencing STMN1 via siRNA could enhance the sensitivity of esophageal cancer cells (Eca-109) to paclitaxel and induce apoptosis.
results_summary: STMN1 silencing significantly increased the sensitivity of Eca-109 cells to paclitaxel and enhanced apoptosis, as confirmed by MTT, colony formation assays, and Hoechst 33258 staining. The effects were statistically significant (P < 0.01).
population_specificity: Esophageal cancer cells (Eca-109) in vitro.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of costunolide on cell viability, cell cycle, and apoptosis in human esophageal cancer Eca-109 cells.
results_summary: Costunolide inhibited Eca-109 cell growth dose-dependently, induced apoptosis via mitochondrial dysfunction and ROS production, and caused G1/S phase arrest by upregulating P53 and P21. These effects were reversed by N-acetylcysteine, indicating ROS-dependent mechanisms.
population_specificity: Human esophageal cancer Eca-109 cells (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of heterophyllin B (HB) on the adhesion and invasion of ECA-109 human esophageal carcinoma cells and explore the underlying mechanism.
results_summary: HB significantly suppressed the adhesion and invasion of ECA-109 cells in a dose-dependent manner, mediated by the PI3K/AKT/β-catenin pathways and regulation of adhesion- and invasion-associated genes. The expression of E-cadherin increased, while snail, vimentin, MMP2, and MMP9 decreased.
population_specificity: ECA-109 human esophageal carcinoma cells

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of 17-AAG combined with paclitaxel (PTX) on the proliferation and apoptosis of esophageal squamous cell carcinoma cell line Eca-109 in vitro.
results_summary: Both 17-AAG and PTX significantly inhibited Eca-109 cell proliferation and promoted apoptosis, with the combination showing stronger effects than either agent alone. The combined treatment caused cell cycle arrest in both G2/M and S phases and significantly increased apoptosis rates compared to single-agent treatments.
population_specificity: Esophageal squamous cell carcinoma cell line Eca-109 (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the role of AQP8 expression and EGFR/ERK1/2 signaling in EGF-induced migration of human esophageal cancer Eca-109 cells.
results_summary: EGF treatment increased AQP8 expression and cell migration in Eca-109 cells, which was blocked by EGFR inhibitor PD153035 and MEK/ERK1/2 inhibitor U0126, indicating the involvement of the EGFR/ERK1/2 pathway.
population_specificity: Human esophageal cancer Eca-109 cells (in vitro study).
effective_dosage: Not specified (EGF, PD153035, and U0126 concentrations not detailed in abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the role of galectin-3 in Eca-109 human esophageal cancer cells, specifically its effects on proliferation, apoptosis, migration, and invasion.
results_summary: The study found that galectin-3 overexpression in Eca-109 cells significantly increased proliferation, migration, and invasion while reducing apoptosis compared to control groups. These results suggest galectin-3 may be a potential molecular target for esophageal cancer treatment.
population_specificity: Eca-109 human esophageal cancer cells

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the cytotoxicity and cell selectivity of the novel hIL-24 peptide M1 in human carcinoma cell lines and normal cells to assess its potential as an anticancer agent.
results_summary: M1 induced growth arrest in IL-20 receptor complex-positive cancer cell lines (Eca-109 and A375) but showed minimal cytotoxicity in receptor-deficient cancer cells (A549) and normal cells (HEL), demonstrating selective anticancer activity. Antibodies against IL-24 or IL-20 receptor complexes neutralized M1's inhibitory effects.
population_specificity: Human carcinoma cell lines (Eca-109, A375, A549) and normal human embryo lung fibroblast cell line (HEL).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the sonoactivity of sinoporphyrin sodium (DVDMS) and its sonotoxicity in an esophageal cancer (ECA-109) cell line.
results_summary: DVDMS showed higher autofluorescence intensity and singlet oxygen production efficiency compared to other photosensitizers, and DVDMS-mediated SDT induced mitochondrial-dependent apoptosis in ECA-109 cells via ROS production.
population_specificity: ECA-109 esophageal cancer cell line.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of hTERT-targeted antisense oligonucleotides (ASODNs) on telomerase activity and cell proliferation in human esophageal cancer cells (Eca-109).
results_summary: The study found that the PS-ASODN inhibited Eca-109 cell proliferation in a concentration-dependent, time-dependent, and sequence-specific manner, with statistically significant inhibition at concentrations ≥2 μmol/l. The PS-ASODN also reduced telomerase activity and induced morphological changes in the cells.
population_specificity: Human esophageal cancer cells (Eca-109) in vitro.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the photodynamic effect of Sinoporphyrin sodium (DVDMS) on Eca-109 cells, focusing on uptake, subcellular localization, phototoxicity, and mechanisms of action.
results_summary: DVDMS showed maximal uptake within 3 hours, localized in mitochondria, and demonstrated high phototoxicity when activated by light, causing significant cell damage, ROS production, DNA damage, and MMP loss. The study concluded DVDMS-PDT effectively inhibited Eca-109 cell proliferation.
population_specificity: Eca-109 cells (esophageal cancer cell line)
study_duration: Not specified (monitored up to 3 hours for uptake)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of TRAIL-expressing mesenchymal stem cells (MSCs) as a gene therapy strategy to inhibit proliferation and induce apoptosis in esophageal cancer cells (Eca-109).
results_summary: TRAIL-expressing MSCs inhibited proliferation and induced apoptosis in Eca-109 cells in vitro and reduced tumor growth in an Eca-109 xenograft mouse model in vivo.
population_specificity: Esophageal cancer cell line Eca-109 and a xenograft mouse model.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of propofol on the proliferation, invasion, and angiogenesis of human Eca-109 cells and explore the underlying mechanisms involving ERK-VEGF/MMP-9 signaling.
results_summary: Propofol significantly promoted apoptosis and inhibited proliferation, invasion, and angiogenesis in Eca-109 cells in a dose- and time-dependent manner, mediated by downregulation of ERK/pERK, VEGF, and MMP-9. ERK activation reversed these effects, confirming the role of ERK-VEGF/MMP-9 signaling.
population_specificity: Human Eca-109 esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (ESCC) cells in vitro.
effective_dosage: 10-100 µmol/L for 72 hours or 100 µmol for 8-72 hours.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of combining EGCG or TF3 with ascorbic acid (Vc) on apoptosis and caspase-3/9 activities in human lung adenocarcinoma (SPC-A-1) and esophageal carcinoma (Eca-109) cells, as well as the role of MAPK pathways in this process.
results_summary: The study found that Vc enhanced EGCG- and TF3-induced apoptosis in SPC-A-1 and Eca-109 cells, involving caspase-3/9 activation. EGCG, TF3, and Vc activated different MAPK subfamilies in different cells, potentially explaining the enhanced apoptosis.
population_specificity: Human lung adenocarcinoma (SPC-A-1) and esophageal carcinoma (Eca-109) cell lines.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the expression and functional role of serum response factor (SRF) in esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (ESCC) and its potential as a diagnostic and therapeutic marker.
results_summary: The study found that SRF expression was increased in ESCC compared to normal controls, and blocking SRF expression inhibited tumor proliferation and invasion in Eca-109 cells.
population_specificity: Human ESCC cases (n=73) and normal controls (n=30), with in vitro experiments on Eca-109 cells.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the growth-inhibiting and pro-apoptotic effects of kaempferol on human esophageal squamous carcinoma Eca-109 cells and explore the underlying mechanism.
results_summary: Kaempferol significantly inhibited Eca-109 cell proliferation in a concentration-dependent manner and induced apoptosis by upregulating Bax, downregulating Bcl-2 mRNA expression, and increasing caspase-3 and caspase-9 activities.
population_specificity: Human esophageal squamous carcinoma Eca-109 cells (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to demonstrate the anxiolytic effect of ECa 233, a standardized extract of Centella asiatica, in comparison to diazepam, using behavioral tests in stressed and non-stressed mice.
results_summary: ECa 233 showed significant anxiolytic effects in both acutely and chronically stressed mice, improving behavioral outcomes in elevated plus maze, dark-light box, and open-field tests. It also ameliorated stress-induced adverse effects on body weight and serum corticosterone levels, with madecassoside and asiaticoside identified as key active components.
population_specificity: Non-stressed and chronically stressed mice.

study_goal: To investigate the inhibitory effect of photodynamic therapy (PDT) combined with paclitaxel (PCT) on proliferation and apoptosis in esophageal carcinoma Eca-109 cells.
results_summary: Combined PDT and PCT treatment significantly reduced cell survival rates and increased apoptosis compared to control and PCT-alone treatments, with dose-dependent effects observed for HPD concentrations.
population_specificity: Eca-109 human esophageal carcinoma cell line.
effective_dosage: PCT for 12 h followed by HPD at high, middle, or low concentrations for 4 h.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the antitumor effects of crotoxin on human esophageal carcinoma (Eca-109) cells in vitro and in transplanted tumors in nude mice.
results_summary: Crotoxin inhibited Eca-109 cell growth in a dose-dependent manner, induced apoptosis and G1 block, and modulated gene and protein expression (upregulating p15 and caspase-3 p17, downregulating Bcl-2). It also reduced tumor growth in nude mice.
population_specificity: Human esophageal carcinoma (Eca-109) cells and female Balb/c nude mice with transplanted Eca-109 tumors.
effective_dosage: 25, 50, and 100 μg/mL (in vitro); 25, 50, and 100 mg/kg (in vivo, every 2 days).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of magnetic stent hyperthermia (MSH) and alternative magnetic field (AMF) exposure on human esophageal cancer cells (ECA-109).
results_summary: The study found that AMF exposure had negligible effects on cell viability, necrosis, and apoptosis, while hyperthermia significantly inhibited cell viability in a thermal dose-dependent manner. The optimal thermal dose for MSH was 48˚C for 20-30 minutes, with differences observed between water bath heating and MSH effects on cell necrosis and apoptosis.
population_specificity: Human esophageal squamous carcinoma (ESCC) ECA-109 cells.
effective_dosage: Hyperthermic temperatures of 43, 48, and 53˚C for 5-30 minutes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine how social networks and social support influence the use of mental health services among individuals with mental illness.
results_summary: The study found that increased contact with social networks and higher levels of social support were associated with greater use of general medical services but fewer services within the specialty psychiatric sector. Social support from relatives and friends had varying impacts on different types of service use.
population_specificity: Individuals with major depressive disorder, generalized anxiety disorder, panic disorder, alcohol use disorder, or recent psychological distress from the Baltimore cohort of the Epidemiologic Catchment Area study.
study_duration: Data were collected over four time points, including 1993-1996 and 2004-2005.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the in vitro anti-cancer effects of isorhamnetin on human esophageal squamous carcinoma cell line Eca-109, focusing on proliferation inhibition and apoptosis induction.
results_summary: Isorhamnetin significantly inhibited Eca-109 cell proliferation (IC50 of 40±0.08 µg/ml) and induced apoptosis, with observed changes in cell cycle distribution (increased G0/G1 phase, reduced G2/M phase) and altered expression of proliferation- and death-related genes (e.g., downregulated bcl-2, c-myc, H-ras; upregulated Bax, c-fos, p53).
population_specificity: Human esophageal squamous carcinoma cell line Eca-109 (in vitro study).
effective_dosage: Graded doses of 0-80 µg/ml for 48 hours.

study_goal: To investigate the effects of 8-Br-cAMP on differentiation and apoptosis of human esophageal cancer cell line Eca-109 and related gene expression.
results_summary: 8-Br-cAMP treatment for 24-48 hours induced differentiation and apoptosis in Eca-109 cells, with upregulation of wt p53, iNOS, p38 kinase, and caspase-3, and downregulation of c-myc, bcl-2, and Fas/FasL. The apoptotic rate was significantly higher after 48 hours compared to 24 hours.
population_specificity: Human esophageal cancer cell line Eca-109

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the circadian rhythms of DNA synthesis and c-myc gene expression in Eca-109 cells treated with isorhmnetin to assess its potential as an anti-cancer agent.
results_summary: The study found that isorhmnetin altered the circadian rhythms of DNA synthesis and c-myc expression in Eca-109 cells, with peak effects observed between 20:00 and 0:00, suggesting potential for chronotherapy in cancer treatment.
population_specificity: Human oesophageal cancer cells (Eca-109) in vitro.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the association between depression and increased alcohol consumption among problem drinkers, with a focus on gender differences.
results_summary: The study found that problem drinkers with prior-year depression had a higher likelihood of transitioning to higher-level drinking, though the association was stronger for men than women. Future research is needed to explore additional sociodemographic and psychopathologic influences.
population_specificity: Problem drinkers (n = 334) from the Baltimore site of the Epidemiologic Catchment Area (ECA) program.
study_duration: Follow-up occurred between 1993 and 1996, with baseline data collected in 1981.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of ginsenoside Rh2 (GS-Rh2) on growth inhibition, cell cycle arrest, and differentiation in the Eca-109 esophageal carcinoma cell line.
results_summary: GS-Rh2 inhibited Eca-109 cell proliferation in a dose- and time-dependent manner, arrested cells at the G0/G1 phase, and induced differentiation toward normal morphology. It also reduced cyclinE and CDK2 expression while increasing p21WAF1 expression.
population_specificity: Eca-109 esophageal carcinoma cell line (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the association between alcohol-use disorders (including "alcohol abuse" and "dependence") and the 14-year risk of death in a community sample.
results_summary: The study found that alcohol-use disorders and heavy alcohol consumption were associated with a higher risk of death and a younger median age of death. The Diagnostic Interview Schedule (DIS) diagnosis of alcohol-use disorder predicted mortality beyond just heavy drinking.
population_specificity: 3,481 adult household residents from the NIMB Baltimore Epidemiologic Catchment Area survey.

study_goal: To evaluate the safety, technical feasibility, and effectiveness of endometrial cryoablation (ECA) as a treatment for menorrhagia.
results_summary: The study found no surgical or long-term complications, with two-thirds of patients followed for over 3 months reporting complete satisfaction. ECA improved menstrual symptoms in 63% of patients during a 3-18 month follow-up period.
population_specificity: 67 women with menorrhagia.
effective_dosage: Two freeze-thaw cycles with 5 ml saline solution.

study_goal: To raise clinician awareness of the methods and findings of the ECA study, the largest psychiatric epidemiology study, and explore its implications for managing psychiatric conditions in Australia.
results_summary: The ECA study found that one in three American adults had experienced a major psychiatric disorder in their lifetime, with one in five having an active disorder at the time of interview. Most disorders began early in life (median age 16) and followed a chronic course, often without appropriate treatment despite higher medical service usage.
population_specificity: Approximately 20,000 American adults.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of Nd YAG laser capsulotomy in improving visual acuity following ECCE.
results_summary: Visual acuity improved in 90% of cases, with a low complication rate (1 retinal detachment, 2 IOP raises, no clinical CME). Laser therapy was performed when visual acuity decreased, without prior extra clinical examination.
population_specificity: 264 consecutive cases of ECCE, with 28 undergoing Nd YAG laser capsulotomy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the regulatory roles of juvenile hormone (JH) and 20-hydroxyecdysone (20E) in ovarian development and reproduction in female Spodoptera frugiperda.
results_summary: JHA and 20E promoted ovarian development, egg maturation, and egg laying by upregulating Met and EcR expression, while knockdown of these genes delayed ovarian development and inhibited reproduction.
population_specificity: Female Spodoptera frugiperda (fall armyworm)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential anti-cancer effects of ecdysteroids, focusing on their mechanisms such as inhibiting proliferation and increasing apoptosis in cancer cells.
results_summary: The study found that ecdysteroids exhibit anti-cancer effects through multiple methods, including inhibiting cancer cell proliferation and promoting apoptosis. These findings suggest potential as an alternative or adjuvant to current cancer therapies.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing research on ecdysteroids and steroidal alkaloids).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the role of host ecdysteroids in stimulating the growth and molting of the parasitoid Exorista sorbillans larvae.
results_summary: The study found that higher ecdysteroid titers in the host correlated with shorter development duration of E. sorbillans larvae. Inhibiting ecdysteroid release repressed 2nd-instar growth and molting, while exogenous 20-hydroxyecdysone (20 E) application rescued these defects by stimulating ecdysone synthesis and signaling.
population_specificity: Parasitoid Exorista sorbillans larvae and their lepidopteran host Bombyx mori.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of ecdysterone-containing supplements on human sports exercise, particularly focusing on muscle mass and strength performance enhancement.
results_summary: The study found significantly higher increases in muscle mass and one-repetition bench press performance in participants dosed with ecdysterone, with no increase in biomarkers for liver or kidney toxicity. The hypertrophic effects were also confirmed in vitro.
population_specificity: Young men (n=46) undergoing strength training.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the antifungal, antiamoebic activity, and acute toxicity of ecdysteroids isolated from Lychnis flos-cuculi.
results_summary: The study found that an 80% methanolic fraction of root extract showed potent amoebicidal activity (IC50 0.06 mg/mL), while isolated ecdysteroids exhibited comparable activity (IC50 0.07 mg/mL). Crude extracts demonstrated moderate antifungal activity (MIC 1.25-2.5 mg/mL), and acute toxicity was higher in 80% fractions compared to 40% fractions.
population_specificity: Pathogenic Acanthamoeba castellani (in vitro study).
effective_dosage: IC50 values of 0.06 mg/mL (root extract) and 0.07 mg/mL (ecdysteroids).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the metabolic fate of ecdysteroids in mice to better understand their mechanism of action and potential benefits.
results_summary: The study found that ecdysteroids undergo complex metabolic transformations in mice, including dehydroxylation and side-chain cleavage, yielding several metabolites. No conjugates were detected, differing from typical vertebrate steroid hormone metabolism.
population_specificity: Mice

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the autoxidation and catalytic hydrogenation of ecdysteroids to form novel hydroxylated derivatives.
results_summary: The study found that autoxidation of ecdysteroid diacetonides in alkaline methanol yields previously undescribed 9α-hydroxy-5α-ecdysteroids, and catalytic hydrogenation produces 7,8α-dihydro-9α-hydroxy-5α-ecdysteroids.
population_specificity: Not applicable (chemical study, no human or animal subjects)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the stereoselective oxidation of ecdysteroids at the 9alpha position using TBAF in THF and to confirm the stereochemistry of the resulting products.
results_summary: The study demonstrated that treating ecdysteroids with TBAF in THF led to stereoselective oxidation at the 9alpha position, yielding 9alpha-hydroxyecdysteroids in good yield. The stereochemistry was confirmed by X-ray analysis, providing a new route to synthesize novel natural and modified steroids.
population_specificity: Not specified (chemical study, not human or animal subjects)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore synthetic modifications of ecdysteroids to optimize their gene-switch potency and ADME properties for use in gene therapy.
results_summary: The study found that methylation at the 22-position of ecdysteroids maintained or enhanced gene-switch potency, with predicted improvements in solubility, permeability, and blood-brain barrier penetration. The SAR analysis identified key hydroxyl groups involved in hydrogen bonding with the EcR.
population_specificity: Engineered gene-switch systems in mammalian cells and natural insect systems (Drosophila B(II) cells).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the gene expression of six CYPs in Carcinus maenas and their response to ecdysteroid and xenobiotic treatment.
results_summary: The study found that CYP2 and CYP3-related genes responded to ecdysteroid treatment, while CYP4-related genes did not, suggesting different physiological roles. The developmental variations in CYP expression indicated a potential mechanism for stage-specific susceptibility to environmental pollutants.
population_specificity: Shore crabs (Carcinus maenas)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to isolate and characterize ecdysteroids from Silene italica ssp. nemoralis and explore their potential therapeutic applications, including anabolic, adaptogenic, and gene-switch induction effects.
results_summary: Nineteen ecdysteroids were isolated, with structural determination of two new compounds detailed. The study highlights ecdysteroids' potential in modern therapy, including their use as gene-switch inducers and their anabolic and adaptogenic effects without typical steroid side effects.
population_specificity: Not specified (focused on compound isolation and characterization).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how ecdysteroids influence larval development and metamorphosis in Sesamia nonagrioides under different photoperiod conditions and with RH-2485 application.
results_summary: The study found that ecdysteroid and juvenile hormone (JH) titers regulate larval molting and pupation, with RH-2485 altering these hormonal patterns. High doses of RH-2485 caused abnormal molting and mortality, while lower doses influenced developmental pathways.
population_specificity: Larvae of Sesamia nonagrioides (a moth species).
effective_dosage: 0.2 ppm, 0.5 ppm, 1 ppm, and 5 ppm RH-2485 applied to diet.
study_duration: Not specified (intervention occurred during the 6th instar larval stage).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the use of ecdysteroids in gene-switch systems for potential gene therapy and assess their pharmacological effects on mammals, including humans.
results_summary: The study found that ecdysteroids have a wide range of beneficial pharmacological effects (e.g., hypoglycemic, hypocholesterolemic, anabolic) but noted concerns about rapid catabolism in mammals and potential doping classification. The metabolic fate of ecdysteroids in humans remains poorly understood.
population_specificity: Mammals, including humans, horses, and dogs.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the role of ecdysteroids in the developmental regulation of transferrin expression in honey bees.
results_summary: The study found that ecdysteroids negatively regulate AmTRF (transferrin) expression in honey bee larvae and pupae, with experimental treatment confirming this effect. Juvenile hormone had only a minor impact on AmTRF transcript levels.
population_specificity: Honey bee (Apis mellifera) larvae and pupae

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the role of hemolymph ecdysteroids in egg production and vitellogenesis in the lubber grasshopper.
results_summary: Hemolymph ecdysteroids peaked and then declined, correlating with egg production timing but not directly regulating vitellogenesis or serving as an ovarian ecdysteroid source. Ovariectomized females had vitellogenin without ecdysteroids, and ecdysteroid treatment did not affect vitellogenin levels or ovarian growth.
population_specificity: Adult female lubber grasshoppers (Romalea microptera).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether ecdysteroids induce an ecdysteroid-inactivation pathway in cotton leafworm larvae and identify the biochemical steps involved.
results_summary: The study found that ecdysteroids (including ecdysone, 20-hydroxyecdysone, and RH 5849) induced an ecdysteroid 26-hydroxylase activity in larvae, leading to the formation of 26-aldehyde and 26-oic acid derivatives, establishing an inactivation pathway. The induction required RNA and protein synthesis.
population_specificity: Last-instar larvae of the cotton leafworm (Spodoptera littoralis).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of 20-hydroxy ecdysone (20-HOE) on cell behavior, including cell division, morphology, and chitin synthesis, in leg and wing imaginal disc cell lines.
results_summary: 20-HOE caused cells to stop dividing, elongate, and aggregate, with increased chitin synthesis in sensitive cell lines (C1.8+), but no effect in resistant lines (C1.8R). The hormone acted optimally at 10 ng/ml, and resistance was developed through gradual exposure.
population_specificity: Leg and wing imaginal disc cell lines (specifically cloned lines C9, C1.8+, and C1.8R).
effective_dosage: 10 ng/ml (optimal concentration), tested up to 150 ng/ml.
study_duration: Effects observed within the first one or two days of passage.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the influence of ecdysteroids (ecdysone and ecdysterone) on reproduction control in the parasitic nematode *Nippostrongylus brasiliensis* in vivo.
results_summary: Treatment with ecdysteroids increased egg-laying in the nematodes, with ecdysone showing the greatest effect, while ecdysterone induced only a small, non-significant stimulation. The timing of the reproductive period remained unaffected.
population_specificity: Parasitic nematode *Nippostrongylus brasiliensis* (infestive larvae, L3 stage).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of KK-42 (an imidazole compound) on ecdysteroid secretion and precocious pupation in silkworm larvae.
results_summary: KK-42 suppressed hemolymph ecdysteroid levels, delaying larval ecdysis and inducing precocious pupation. The compound inhibited ecdysone secretion in vitro, with a half-inhibition concentration of approximately 1 nM.
population_specificity: Fourth (penultimate) and fifth instar larvae of the silkworm, Bombyx mori.
study_duration: Effects observed for about 6 days post-treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a robust hydrophilic coating on PTFE hollow fiber membranes to enhance filtration performance and durability in wastewater treatment.
results_summary: The study successfully created a double-layer hydrogel coating (PVA/PIC) on PTFE membranes, which improved strength, chemical resistance, and antifouling performance by repelling various pollutants effectively.
population_specificity: Not applicable (material science study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of fermented bamboo fiber (FBF) supplementation on growth performance, intestinal barrier integrity, gut microbiota, and fecal pollutants in weaned piglets.
results_summary: FBF supplementation improved intestinal barrier function, modulated gut microbiota, and reduced fecal pollutants, with 1.5% FBF showing the most significant benefits in growth performance and environmental impact.
population_specificity: Weaned Duroc × Landrace × Yorkshire piglets (21 days old).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the prevalence and risk factors of peripheral neuropathy (both large and small fiber damage) in Parkinson's disease patients and examine the impact of oral levodopa on neuropathy incidence.
results_summary: 55.56% of PD patients exhibited peripheral neuropathy, with higher UPDRSIII scores and advanced age identified as independent risk factors. No significant difference in neuropathy incidence was found between patients receiving oral levodopa and those not receiving it.
population_specificity: 117 Parkinson's disease patients from Guangdong Provincial People's Hospital.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a lab-on-fiber device for rapid, cost-effective, in situ detection of analytes like Monomeric Streptavidin, Neutravidin, and Creatine Kinase-MB.
results_summary: The study demonstrated proof of concept for a fiber-based device using motor-protein-driven microtubules to detect specific analytes, showing decreased microtubule speed and bundling in response to targets, enabling label-free and microscope-free detection.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the impact of the Mediterranean diet pattern (MDP), rich in fiber, on the fecal metabolome and microbiota in patients with quiescent ulcerative colitis (UC).
results_summary: The study found that high adherence to the MDP led to beneficial metabolite changes linked to reduced inflammation in UC, with fiber-degrading microbes like Bacteroides species playing a key role in dietary responsiveness.
population_specificity: Adult patients with quiescent ulcerative colitis (n=16, split into MDP and CHD groups).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a high-fiber diet or acetate supplementation could improve gut microbiota composition and cardiac function in alcoholic heart disease (AHD) mouse models.
results_summary: The study found that high-fiber diets and acetate supplementation improved cardiac fibrosis and heart failure in AHD mice, modulated lipid metabolism and TGF-β signaling genes, and enhanced beneficial gut bacteria like Akkermansia muciniphila, Lactobacillus intestinalis, and Bacteroides acidifaciens. These changes correlated with improved cardiac outcomes, suggesting a gut-heart axis mechanism.
population_specificity: Male C57BL/6 mice with alcoholic heart disease (AHD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of high-pressure homogenization (HPH) on the physicochemical properties of coconut insoluble dietary fiber (CIDF) and its ability to inhibit pancreatic lipase (PL) activity.
results_summary: HPH reduced CIDF particle size, increased water and oil holding capacities, and significantly enhanced PL inhibitory activity (up to 72.51%). The modified CIDF showed stronger PL inhibition than unmodified CIDF, likely due to exposed hydroxyl groups facilitating binding to PL.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether long-term consumption of high-purity soy isolate dietary fiber (HPSIDF) could alleviate intestinal damage caused by chronic ulcerative colitis (CUC) by promoting beneficial intestinal substances.
results_summary: Long-term HPSIDF intake regulated inflammatory factors, relieved intestinal tissue damage, inhibited degradation of Lactobacillus intestinalis, and promoted proliferation of Oscillospira and beneficial metabolites like Agmatine and Betaine.
population_specificity: Mice with induced chronic ulcerative colitis (CUC) using 2% dextran sulfate sodium (DSS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to highlight technical considerations and potential pitfalls for surgeons using CFR-PEEK instrumentation in metastatic spine tumor surgery (MSTS).
results_summary: The review identified key factors for CFR-PEEK use in MSTS, including preoperative planning, intraoperative handling, and postoperative considerations like radiotherapy planning. It emphasized the benefits of reduced imaging artifacts compared to titanium implants.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing metastatic spine tumor surgery (MSTS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a novel carbonaceous, mesoporous cellulose-nanocrystal (GOF@n-CL) extracted from Grewia Optiva fiber for removing pharmaceuticals from wastewater.
results_summary: The study found that GOF@n-CL achieved high removal rates for pharmaceuticals, including 96% for tetracycline, 81% for ciprofloxacin, and 78% for ofloxacin, with adsorption mechanisms involving pore diffusion, hydrogen bonding, and electrostatic interactions.
population_specificity: Wastewater treatment (not human or animal subjects).
effective_dosage: Not specified (batch studies used, but exact dosage not detailed).
study_duration: Not specified (batch study duration not mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop an ultrasensitive, rapid, and low-cost fiber optic nanogold-linked sorbent assay for detecting procalcitonin (PCT), a sepsis biomarker.
results_summary: The study successfully developed a novel aptamer-based method for PCT detection with a linear response range of 500 fg/mL to 5.0 ng/mL and a detection limit of 50 fg/mL. The method showed strong correlation with clinical electrochemiluminescence immunoassay results.
population_specificity: Clinical samples (specific population not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a novel membrane Fenton (MF) technique to reduce hazardous sludge production and improve efficiency in treating refractory industrial wastewater.
results_summary: The optimized membrane exhibited high water permeability and low effluent turbidity, reducing ferrous ion input and sludge production by 50% while maintaining comparable chemical oxygen demand removal efficiency to conventional methods. The membranes also showed excellent chemical and mechanical stability over 40 days.
population_specificity: Industrial wastewater treatment (metronidazole pharmaceutical wastewater).
study_duration: 8 continuous reaction batches (specific duration not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the repair efficacy of a collagen peptide-based composite human hair repair emulsion (CHFRE) on damaged hair using structural and biochemical analyses.
results_summary: CHFRE treatment significantly improved damaged hair's physical and chemical properties, including enhanced luster, aligned cuticle scales, increased protein stability, and reduced oxidative damage. The study demonstrated a 5.94% increase in α-conformation content and a 28.44% rise in relative helical content, indicating structural restoration closer to normal hair.
population_specificity: Damaged human hair (no specific human demographic details provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to reduce optical scattering loss in chalcogenide fibers by improving the core-cladding interface quality using an extrusion-assisted hot-diffusion method.
results_summary: The hot-diffusion treatment reduced fiber loss by 58%, from 4.5 to 1.88 dB/m in the 5-6 μm range, with a minimum loss of 0.68 dB/m at 2.64 μm, confirming its effectiveness.
population_specificity: Not applicable (material science study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how O2 and N2 plasma treatment improves HDPE surface wettability and enhances the interface compatibility and mechanical properties of HDPE/bamboo fiber composites.
results_summary: Plasma treatment significantly improved HDPE surface wettability, enhancing interface compatibility and increasing impact strength (19.91% for O2, 19.55% for N2) and tensile strength (16.47% for O2, 12.48% for N2). N2 plasma had a better effect on wettability than O2 plasma.
population_specificity: HDPE/bamboo fiber composites (not human or animal subjects).
effective_dosage: Optimal process parameters: 1100 W, 13 s, 1.75 L/min (O2 plasma); 1100 W, 13 s, 2.5 L/min (N2 plasma).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop an integrated fiber-optic theranostic (iFOT) probe for simultaneous tumor microenvironment sensing and photothermal therapy to improve compactness and compatibility with existing medical technologies.
results_summary: The iFOT probe demonstrated high sensitivity in detecting hypoxia in xenograft tumors and achieved effective photothermal tumor killing with a high cure rate, while also being compatible with conventional medical imaging and endoscopic techniques.
population_specificity: Xenograft tumors in mice.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether dietary fiber consistently enhances immune checkpoint blockade (ICB) efficacy across different cancer types and dietary contexts in mouse models.
results_summary: The study found that dietary fiber had a weaker and inconsistent impact on ICB efficacy than previously reported, with no consistent pattern of improved efficacy across tumor models. Other dietary factors, not fiber itself, may explain clinical correlations between fiber intake and immunotherapy outcomes.
population_specificity: Mice with implantable and spontaneous genetically engineered tumor models.
effective_dosage: Not specified (differing quantities of isolated fibers: cellulose and inulin).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the mechanical, physical, and thermal properties of biodegradable composites reinforced with natural fibers (Kenaf, Bagasse, Hemp, and softwood) after alkaline treatment.
results_summary: Fiber reinforcement improved tensile and impact strength in PP composites, particularly for treated Bagasse and Hemp, while Kenaf showed minimal change due to its inherent strength. Treated fibers enhanced thermal properties, with Kenaf achieving the highest HDT (124 °C), and fiber mapping revealed Kenaf's superior aspect ratio contributed to better mechanical performance.
population_specificity: Biodegradable composites (PP and PLA matrices reinforced with natural fibers).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the relationship between C-tactile (CT) fiber stimulation and psychological disorders, evaluating its potential as a therapeutic intervention.
results_summary: Most studies reported sensory alterations in individuals with psychological disorders, with affective touch rated as less pleasant. Limited evidence suggests affective touch therapies can reduce symptom severity and improve interoception across psychological conditions.
population_specificity: Individuals with psychological disorders (specific diagnoses not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop and validate a novel anisotropic constitutive fiber model to predict the mechanical behavior of porcine urethral tissue, comparing it with existing hyperelastic models.
results_summary: The study found that the novel fiber model demonstrated improved accuracy in predicting mechanical properties of porcine urethral tissue, matching the performance of the GOH model with lower RMSEs (9.24% and 12.98% in circumferential and longitudinal directions, respectively), while conventional models like Yeoh and Ogden failed to fit both directions with a single parameter set.
population_specificity: Porcine urethral tissue (used as a proxy for human urethral tissue in preclinical studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical characteristics of patients with different stages of LHON, focusing on OCT imaging results and genetic mutations.
results_summary: The study found that chronic LHON patients exhibited significantly thinner retinal nerve fiber layer (RNFL) and ganglion cell layer (GCL) thickness, particularly in the temporal region, compared to acute patients. Genetic analysis revealed G11778A as the most common mutation, with G3460A being the second most frequent.
population_specificity: 22 individuals with LHON (median age 33, range 9-68).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a fiber structure composed of hollow carbon spheres and transition metal catalysts to improve stability and reversibility as an electrochemical catalyst in zinc-air batteries.
results_summary: The study found that the fiber structure demonstrated improved stability and reversibility when used as an electrochemical catalyst in zinc-air batteries, achieved through a combination of electrostatic spinning and heat treatment.
population_specificity: Not applicable (material science study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of combining Enzyme-Induced Calcium Carbonate Precipitation (EICP) with coir fiber on the compressive characteristics of calcarenite sand for construction applications.
results_summary: The study found that increasing EICP grouting cycles reduced the void ratio of calcarenite sand, while coir fiber initially decreased this reduction before increasing it. The Harris function and Lasso regularization method successfully modeled these relationships, demonstrating high predictive accuracy.
population_specificity: Calcarenite sand used in the construction of South China Sea islands and reefs.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of electrospun polymer fiber mats as a novel drug delivery system for local delivery of antibacterial drugs, specifically for wound dressings or periodontitis treatment.
results_summary: The study demonstrated that electrospun fibers with varying architectures could incorporate metronidazole, suppress burst effects, and achieve sustained drug release. The fibers showed reduced crystallinity of the drug, indicating potential for controlled release applications.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study).
effective_dosage: Drug content in fibers ranged from 7-27 wt %.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of cusp reduction and coronal polyethylene fiber reinforcement on cusp deflection and fracture strength in endodontically treated molar teeth.
results_summary: Fiber reinforcement reduced cusp deflection and increased fracture strength significantly compared to groups without fiber. Cusp reduction also led to less deflection and higher fracture strength than no reduction.
population_specificity: Endodontically treated molar teeth (120 intact molars divided into 12 groups).
effective_dosage: Not applicable (fiber was used as a structural reinforcement, not consumed).
study_duration: Not specified (study measured immediate effects post-restoration).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the protective mechanisms of MDHB (a natural phenolic acid compound) against muscle fiber necrosis and macrophage pyroptosis in idiopathic inflammatory myopathies (IIM) by regulating oxidative stress.
results_summary: MDHB reduced oxidative stress markers (ROS, MitoSOX), improved mitochondrial function, and inhibited necroptosis in muscle cells and myotubes. In vivo, MDHB alleviated muscle weakness, inflammation, and pyroptosis in EAM mice by activating the Nrf2/HO-1 pathway.
population_specificity: Experimental autoimmune myositis (EAM) mice and C2C12 cells/myotubes (in vitro).
effective_dosage: Not specified (dose-dependent effects noted in vitro).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop innovative methods for synthesizing porous carbon fibers (PCFs) with tunable pore sizes and distributions for applications in energy storage, composites, and filtration.
results_summary: The study demonstrated that block copolymer precursors can produce PCFs with controlled porosity, enhancing surface area, electrical/ionic conductivity, and polymer-matrix interactions, which are beneficial for energy storage and other applications. Challenges with nonuniform pore distribution and hazardous chemical use in traditional methods were highlighted.
population_specificity: Not applicable (material science research).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of Ribbond tape (RT) in improving fracture resistance and preventing crack propagation in endodontically treated teeth compared to traditional methods.
results_summary: The study found that using RT to reinforce endodontically treated teeth enhanced mechanical retention, inhibited fracture propagation, and established a strong chemical bond with resin, leading to complete remission of symptoms in patients after two years.
population_specificity: Patients with endodontically treated teeth exhibiting cracks, enlarged roots, or weakened root walls.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the initial results of Thulium fiber laser (TFL) versus holmium:YAG laser with MOSES technology in retrograde intrarenal surgery (RIRS) for treating renal and ureteral stones.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in operative time, stone-free rate, or complications between TFL and Ho:YAG laser, but TFL had a significantly shorter basketing time. Both lasers showed high efficacy and safety in treating stones.
population_specificity: Patients with renal or ureteral stones ≤20 mm in diameter scheduled for single-stage RIRS.
effective_dosage: TFL (60 W) and Ho:YAG laser with MOSES technology (120 W).
study_duration: Single-stage procedure; follow-up at 1 month post-RIRS.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of fiber-reinforced composites (Dentapreg® UFM) in structural reinforcement and apical closure for traumatized teeth with open apices.
results_summary: The study found that fiber-reinforced composites, combined with laser disinfection and apexification, successfully reinforced damaged teeth and achieved apical closure, demonstrating the effectiveness of modern endodontic techniques.
population_specificity: A 42-year-old female patient with mature permanent teeth exhibiting open apices and structural damage due to trauma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effects of prebiotic fiber supplementation combined with weight loss counseling on liver fat, body composition, appetite, serum metabolomics, and gut microbiota in adults with MASLD.
results_summary: Prebiotic fiber supplementation did not significantly reduce liver fat compared to placebo but led to greater reductions in trunk fat, decreased hunger and desire to eat, increased Bifidobacterium abundance, and conserved taurine metabolism.
population_specificity: Adults aged 18-70 with MASLD.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the feasibility and safety of using a dual-wavelength fiber laser combined with flexible endoscopes for porcine anterior commissure resection, as a potential method for human laryngeal surgery.
results_summary: The study found that the anterior commissure in all five pigs was well exposed and smoothly resected without complications, demonstrating the feasibility and safety of the technique. The resection range reached the thyroid cartilage plate, with no obstruction issues from the laryngoscope.
population_specificity: Five healthy adult pigs.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of incorporating quinoa flour and date seed powder as fiber sources on the functional properties, health benefits, and sensory attributes of chicken and fish nuggets.
results_summary: The study found that adding quinoa flour and date seed powder improved dietary fiber content, water holding capacity, cooking yield, and pH levels while reducing oil absorption. The T3 formulation (75:25 ratio) achieved the highest overall sensory acceptance.
population_specificity: Chicken and fish nuggets (food product study, not human subjects).
effective_dosage: 6% concentration with varying ratios of quinoa flour to date seed powder (0:0, 100:0, 75:25, 50:50).
