study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of a Prussian blue/luffa fiber composite for removing cesium ions from radioactive wastewater.
results_summary: The composite demonstrated high selective removal efficiency for Cs+ ions, with a maximum adsorption capacity of 102.01 mg/g, retained 71.2% efficiency after 3 cycles, and showed no obvious biotoxicity in phytotoxicity assessments.
population_specificity: Radioactive wastewater treatment (no human or animal subjects specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effect of different crown ferrule heights on the fracture resistance of endodontically treated teeth restored with glass fiber posts and evaluate failure patterns.
results_summary: The study found that increasing ferrule length significantly improved fracture resistance in glass fiber post-restored teeth, with 2 mm and 3 mm ferrules showing comparable results. Glass fiber posts with adequate ferrule lengths resulted in more repairable failures compared to metal posts, which had higher fracture resistance but more non-repairable failures.
population_specificity: Extracted human maxillary central incisors (n=56)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of a carbon nanotube fiber-based median nerve interface for managing myocardial ischemia, comparing it to vagus nerve stimulation and electroacupuncture.
results_summary: The study found that median nerve stimulation using carbon nanotube fibers at acupoint PC6 achieved therapeutic effects comparable to electroacupuncture, with improvements in cardiac metrics and superior safety and ease of operation compared to vagus nerve stimulation. Histological and fluorescence analyses confirmed the long-term safety of the interface.
population_specificity: The study focused on myocardial ischemia, but the specific human or animal population was not detailed in the abstract.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of different post space preparation systems (Rebilda and RelyX) and varying preparation lengths on the formation of root dentinal cracks.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in completed and advanced cracks between groups, but newly formed cracks were more frequent with Rebilda-2/3 and RelyX-2/3 preparations compared to RelyX-1/2. The RelyX drill and shorter preparation length (1/2 of canal length) were associated with fewer cracks.
population_specificity: Extracted maxillary first premolars with two roots (in vitro study).
effective_dosage: Not applicable (mechanical preparation lengths: 1/2 or 2/3 of working length).
study_duration: Not specified (single intervention with pre- and post-µCT scans).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether dietary fiber supplementation, specifically resistant starch (RS) and inulin-type fructans (ITF), could prevent cardiovascular damage and high blood pressure in a genetic model of neurogenic hypertension.
results_summary: RS fiber reduced vascular oxidative stress, inflammation, and high blood pressure, while ITF failed to prevent hypertension or endothelial dysfunction. The benefits of RS were linked to reshaped gut microbiota, increased short-chain fatty acid production, and reduced sympathetic activity.
population_specificity: Male spontaneously hypertensive rats (SHR) and normotensive Wistar Kyoto rats (WKY).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether dietary fiber intake influences the risk of developing immune-related colitis in melanoma patients treated with ipilimumab ± nivolumab.
results_summary: The study found that higher dietary fiber intake was negatively associated with diarrhea and colitis, suggesting a protective effect, though the association was not statistically significant (p = 0.061). No significant differences were observed in other dietary components or patient characteristics.
population_specificity: Patients with metastasized stage III or IV melanoma treated with ipilimumab ± nivolumab.
effective_dosage: Not specified (assessed via food frequency questionnaire).
study_duration: Dietary habits were assessed in a median of six months after treatment initiation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a new, cost-effective, and rapid method for screening therapeutic targets of active ingredients in traditional Chinese medicine, specifically focusing on isoquercitrin's mechanism in treating insulin resistance.
results_summary: The study identified PTPN1 as the main target of isoquercitrin in treating insulin resistance, with strong binding affinities confirmed via fiber optic SPR biosensor. The proposed method demonstrated high sensitivity (0.699 nm/(μg/ml)), low detection limit (0.515μg/ml), and rapid detection time (45 minutes).
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the feasibility, safety, and efficacy of using thulium fiber laser (TFL) in combination with thulium laser enucleation of the prostate (ThuLEP) for treating benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) complicated by bladder stones (BS).
results_summary: The study found that ThuLEP+TFL resulted in shorter surgery duration, less blood loss, faster recovery, and improved postoperative outcomes (e.g., lower IPSS scores, higher QoL) compared to traditional TUEP plus bladder lithotomy, with no significant difference in stone clearance but fewer complications.
population_specificity: 31 patients with BPH complicated by bladder stones (observation group) compared to 31 patients undergoing traditional surgery (control group).
study_duration: Intervention duration not explicitly stated; follow-up results were assessed.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the effects and mechanisms of buckwheat total dietary fiber (BDF) on improving type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) symptoms in db/db mice.
results_summary: BDF significantly improved hyperglycemia, hyperlipidemia, insulin resistance, body weight, inflammatory response, and intestinal function in db/db mice. It also modulated gut microbiota, bile acids, and their receptors, and activated the hepatic IRS-1/PI3K/AKT pathway to enhance glucose metabolism.
population_specificity: db/db mice (a model for T2DM)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether baicalin could influence skeletal muscle fiber conversion from glycolytic to oxidative fibers and explore its underlying mechanisms.
results_summary: Baicalin promoted the conversion from glycolytic to oxidative fibers in mice and pigs, evidenced by increased oxidative fiber-related gene expression, SDH enzyme activity, and mitochondrial complex expression, while decreasing glycolytic fiber-related gene expression and LDH activity. The effect was mediated through activation of the p38 MAPK/PGC-1α signaling pathway.
population_specificity: C2C12 cells (in vitro), C57BL/6J mice, and weaned piglets (in vivo).
effective_dosage: 125 μM (in vitro), dosage for in vivo models not specified.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the 15-year clinical success and survival rates of endodontically treated teeth restored with glass-fiber posts versus metal posts.
results_summary: The study found a trend toward better success and survival rates for teeth restored with prefabricated glass-fiber posts (59.2% success, 68.5% survival) compared to metal posts (48.0% success, 53.6% survival), though the differences were not statistically significant. Teeth with metal posts failed more frequently due to root fractures than those with glass-fiber posts.
population_specificity: 131 patients requiring 182 post and single-crown restorations.
effective_dosage: Not applicable (post materials used, not a consumable dosage).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the compressive strength of fiber-reinforced composites compared to non-reinforced composites for restoring incisal edge fractures.
results_summary: Fiber-reinforced composites (Groups 2 and 4) showed significantly higher fracture resistance compared to non-reinforced composites (Groups 1 and 3). Mixed failures were more common in non-reinforced groups, while cohesive failures dominated in fiber-reinforced groups.
population_specificity: Extracted human maxillary incisors (n=60).
effective_dosage: Not specified (fiber placement in prepared grooves with flowable composite).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate how konjac fiber (KF) and konjac powder (KP) modulate appetite, chyme digestion, gastrointestinal hormones, and related mechanisms via the stomach-intestine-brain axis in rats.
results_summary: Highly-expanded konjac fiber (HKF) delayed gastric emptying, inhibited chyme hydrolysis, increased SCFA content and GLP-1 levels, upregulated GLP-1R protein expression in specific tissues, and downregulated appetite genes (AgRP/NPY), leading to reduced food intake and weight gain.
population_specificity: Rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop an innovative dual-layer hollow fiber mixed matrix membrane (DLHF-MMM) for regenerating spent dialysis solution, reducing water demand and waste generation in hemodialysis.
results_summary: The DLHF-MMM effectively removed small, medium, and large weight uremic toxins, achieving high water permeability and adsorption capacity for urea and creatinine, with favorable removal rates in actual patient dialysis solutions.
population_specificity: Patients with end-stage kidney disease (ESKD) undergoing hemodialysis.
effective_dosage: 6 wt% of amine-functionalized mesoporous silica nanoparticles (MPS-NPs) in the membrane.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the antibacterial efficacy and safety of manganese oxide nanosheets on carbon fibers (CM) for combating bacterial infections through mechanical intervention and postcharging therapy.
results_summary: The CM demonstrated high antibacterial activity, achieving over 98% lethality rates against Escherichia coli and Staphylococcus aureus within 0.5 hours after charging at -1 V for 50.4 ± 3 seconds, with low cytotoxicity to fibroblast cells.
population_specificity: Bacterial cultures (Escherichia coli and Staphylococcus aureus) and fibroblast cells.
effective_dosage: Charging at -1 V (vs SCE) for 50.4 ± 3 seconds.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of nanochitosan-coated cotton fiber (NCCF) in removing heavy metals from industrial wastewater.
results_summary: NCCF demonstrated superior adsorption capacity for heavy metals (Cd2+, Pb2+, Cr6+) compared to uncoated cotton fiber, with higher initial adsorption rates and shorter half-times. The study confirmed NCCF's potential as a sustainable and effective material for wastewater treatment.
population_specificity: Industrial wastewater (not human or animal subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a fiber-optic sensor for simultaneous measurement of refractive index (RI) and temperature (T) to improve monitoring in photo-thermal therapy (PTT) within the blood circulation system.
results_summary: The study demonstrated that the sensor achieved synchronous detection of RI and T with sensitivities of 3.58 (a.u.)/RIU and -0.0011 (a.u.)/°C, respectively. The MZI signal showed over 30 times enhancement in the figure of merit (FOM) compared to the LSPR signal, making it a promising tool for in vivo PTT.
population_specificity: Not specified (focused on sensor development, not human or animal subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the impact of lentil hull soluble dietary fibers (SDFs) on colitis and cognitive deficits in mice, exploring potential benefits via the gut-brain axis.
results_summary: SDFs significantly improved inflammatory symptoms in the colon and brain, as well as cognitive behaviors, with LSDF showing better efficacy than HSDF. LSDF reduced harmful bacteria abundance, increased beneficial bacteria, and influenced brain metabolites through sphingolipid metabolism.
population_specificity: Mice with colitis and behavioral deficits.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to clarify the role of GbSMXL8 in cotton fiber development and its involvement in strigolactone signaling pathways.
results_summary: The study found that GbSMXL8 negatively regulates cotton fiber development, with knockout increasing fiber length and plant growth. Exogenous strigolactones (GR24) promoted fiber elongation, and GbSMXL8 expression was responsive to GR24 treatment.
population_specificity: Cotton plants (Gossypium barbadense)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of PET C-CP fiber columns for isolating bovine milk-derived extracellular vesicles (MDEVs) as a potential therapeutic delivery vector.
results_summary: PET C-CP fiber columns successfully isolated MDEVs from raw milk with high purity (∼2 × 10¹⁰ EVs µg⁻¹ protein) and concentration (1.5 × 10¹⁰ particles mL⁻¹) in under 20 minutes, outperforming conventional isolation methods. The efficacy was confirmed through multiple characterization methods, suggesting scalability for therapeutic applications.
population_specificity: Bovine milk (not human subjects).
study_duration: Isolation process completed in less than 20 minutes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether chemically treated hemp fibers could improve the mechanical properties of PLA filaments for 3D printing.
results_summary: Untreated hemp reduced PLA strength, but cationization with EPTA improved interfacial adhesion and increased tensile strength by 615%. Combining treated fibers with GMA further optimized mechanical properties, achieving results similar to pure PLA.
population_specificity: Not applicable (material science study, no human or animal subjects).
effective_dosage: Not specified (material proportions implied but not quantified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of dietary fiber interventions on glycemic control and weight management in individuals with diabetes or at risk for diabetes.
results_summary: The study found significant improvements in glycemic markers (fasting plasma glucose, HbA1c, postprandial glucose) and weight management (body weight, waist circumference), along with secondary benefits like improved lipid profiles, insulin sensitivity, and gut microbiota. Most studies showed a low risk of bias, supporting robust evidence.
population_specificity: Individuals with diabetes or at risk for diabetes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the influence of different chain-length perfluorocarboxylic acids (PFCAs) on nitrogen removal in constructed wetlands amended with modified basalt fiber bio-nest (CW-BF).
results_summary: The study found that perfluorooctanoic acid (PFOA) significantly decreased ammonium (NH4+-N) by 20.65-24.79% in later stages and increased nitrate (NO3--N) removal by 3.02-5.21% from April to August, while perfluorobutanoic acid (PFBA) had slighter impacts. PFOA suppressed nitrifying enzyme activities but stimulated denitrifying bacteria and functional genes.
population_specificity: Constructed wetlands (CWs) amended with modified basalt fiber bio-nest.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the relationship between retinal nerve fiber layer (RNFL) thickness and cognition in Idiopathic Parkinson's disease (IPD) patients without visual symptoms or dementia.
results_summary: The study found pronounced RNFL thinning in IPD patients, particularly in the right nasal inferior quadrant, and cognitive issues in 47% of IPD subjects. It suggested a potential link between visuospatial domain effects and disease severity but did not establish a direct association between disease severity/duration and OCT measurements.
population_specificity: Idiopathic Parkinson's disease (IPD) patients without visual symptoms or dementia, compared to healthy controls.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of a high-fiber intervention on hyperphagia, metabolic health, and gut microbiota in individuals with Prader-Willi Syndrome (PWS).
results_summary: The fiber intervention did not significantly alter hyperphagia or key metabolic markers but led to shifts in gut microbiota diversity, increased beneficial bacteria, and altered fecal and serum metabolites.
population_specificity: Individuals with Prader-Willi Syndrome (median age 13.6 years, 57.1% female).
study_duration: 3 weeks per treatment phase, with a 4-8 week washout period.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of photodynamic therapy (PDT) with different photosensitizers, including phthalocyanine (Pc), on the penetration depth and area of self-adhesive resin cement into dentinal tubules in endodontic treatment.
results_summary: The study found that while adhesive penetration depth did not differ significantly among groups, penetration area varied at 1 mm and 5 mm sections. Methylene blue showed a higher penetration area at 1 mm compared to phthalocyanine, but phthalocyanine demonstrated generally similar efficacy to other photosensitizers.
population_specificity: Forty single-canal, round-shaped lower premolar teeth.
study_duration: Samples were stored for 7 days post-treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine fiber-specific white matter differences in Bipolar Disorder (BD) and Depressive Disorder (DD) using fixel-based analysis (FBA) and assess whether FBA metrics could predict future mood symptom trajectories.
results_summary: The study found distinct white matter alterations in BD and DD, with lower fiber density (FD) in specific tracts for each disorder. FD in key tracts predicted future symptom severity, suggesting its potential as a biomarker for mood disorder prognosis.
population_specificity: 163 individuals aged 18-45 with BD, DD, and healthy controls.
interactions: Exploratory analyses noted associations between FD, medication use, and marijuana exposure.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the combined impact of fiber and exercise on gut-liver axis modulation and MASLD amelioration in mice.
results_summary: Fiber supplementation combined with exercise reduced fat mass gain and lowered plasma glucose levels, but only the combination treatment induced fat loss and decreased plasma triglyceride and cholesterol levels. Fiber alone remodeled gut microbial composition, while exercise alone reduced hepatic inflammatory markers.
population_specificity: Male APOE*3-Leiden.CETP mice fed a high-fat high-cholesterol diet.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze pathological features of recurrent cardiac myxoma to assess recurrence risk factors, particularly focusing on the relationship between tumor cells and the elastic fiber layer.
results_summary: The study found that disruption of the elastic fiber layer and tumor cell invasion into the myocardium were statistically associated with recurrence. Logistic regression identified tumor cell invasion through the elastic fiber layer as an independent risk factor for recurrence.
population_specificity: Patients who underwent cardiac myxoma surgery at Beijing Anzhen Hospital from 2002 to 2016 (recurrence group: n=6; control group: n=73).
study_duration: Recurrence time ranged from 1-7 years (average 4.8 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically investigate the relationships among dietary fiber, microbiota disturbance, and disease development, and to classify fibers and diseases based on their microbiota-modulating effects.
results_summary: The study classified 32 dietary fibers into six functional subgroups, established associations among 161 diseases based on microbiota disturbance patterns, and identified 1659 fiber-disease associations. It also validated the effects of arabinoxylan in murine models of inflammatory bowel disease, showing alignment with predicted microbiota changes.
population_specificity: Murine models (mice) and computational analysis of human disease-microbiota associations.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the fracture resistance of immediate versus delayed restorations (using fiber-reinforced materials) after root canal treatment.
results_summary: The study found that delaying permanent restorations for 3 months did not significantly affect fracture resistance, with the highest resistance in fiber-reinforced immediate restorations (Group III) and the lowest in delayed fiber-reinforced restorations (Group VI). Most repairable fractures occurred in non-fiber-reinforced groups (I and II).
population_specificity: Human intact premolar teeth (in vitro study).
study_duration: 3 months (simulated aging for delayed restoration groups).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how static magnetic field (SMF) pretreatment affects the structural, functional, and antioxidant properties of dietary fiber derived from corn sprouts.
results_summary: SMF pretreatment improved the structural characteristics (pore density, surface profile), functional properties (thermal stability, enzyme inhibition), and antioxidant activity of dietary fiber from corn sprouts. It also enhanced water holding, oil holding, and water swelling capacities.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study on corn sprouts)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of Ca-TCPB as a fiber coating for solid-phase microextraction (SPME) to detect and enrich polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs) in environmental samples.
results_summary: The study demonstrated that Ca-TCPB exhibited high extraction efficiency for PAHs, with a wide linear range, low detection limits, and high enrichment factors. The method successfully detected trace PAHs in pond water with good recoveries, attributed to strong interactions like π-π stacking and hydrogen bonding.
population_specificity: Environmental samples (pond water)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of different glass fiber post (GFP) systems on bond strength to intraradicular dentin using two types of dual-curing resin cements.
results_summary: Anatomical posts (AP) and Splendor posts showed similar bond strength in apical and middle root sections, outperforming milled CAD/CAM posts. In the cervical section, AP posts had significantly higher bond strength. Self-adhesive resin cement provided lower bond strength for milled CAD/CAM posts in cervical and middle thirds but higher bond strength for AP posts in the apical third.
population_specificity: Bovine incisors with wide canals (in vitro study).
effective_dosage: Not applicable (material application followed manufacturer instructions).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to characterize and differentiate the stem signal from the primary radioluminescence signal in optical fiber dosimetry to improve measurement accuracy.
results_summary: The study successfully used Monte Carlo simulations to distinguish stem signals from scintillation signals and differentiate between fluorescence and Cerenkov signals, enhancing the understanding of optical fiber RL dosimetry systems.
population_specificity: Not applicable (simulation-based study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the effect of prebiotic fiber supplementation on gut microbiota and nutritional status in elderly volunteers with Parkinson's disease.
results_summary: The study found statistically significant improvements in calf circumference and trends in other nutritional markers (BMI, body weight, etc.). Gut microbiota analysis showed changes in bacterial families and genera, including reductions in Verrucomicrobia, which is abundant in Parkinson's disease.
population_specificity: Elderly volunteers with Parkinson's disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to enhance poly-ε-caprolactone (PCL) scaffolds for tendon tissue engineering by improving filament morphology and collagen coating to optimize cell response.
results_summary: Snowflake-shaped PCL fibers combined with collagen coating showed significant improvements in cell viability and proliferation, suggesting better cell guidance and adhesion compared to circular fibers. Immunofluorescence staining indicated alignment of cell growth with fiber direction.
population_specificity: Primary tenocytes (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to provide a comprehensive overview of the clinical and diagnostic features of PASC-related small fiber neuropathy (SFN), including associated disorders, disease progression, and potential treatments.
results_summary: The study found that PASC-SFN often presents with distal limb burning pain, numbness, and dysautonomia, alongside cognitive, visual, and osteoarticular disorders. Diagnosis relies on skin biopsy and complementary tests, while treatment involves various symptomatic and disease-modifying drugs with partial success.
population_specificity: Patients with post-acute sequelae of COVID-19 (PASC) experiencing small fiber neuropathy (SFN).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether incorporating a silane-based surface treatment into the dispersion process could improve the mechanical and surface properties of recycled carbon fiber (rCF) nonwoven fabrics.
results_summary: The study found that using an optimal amount of silane increased mechanical strength by 64% compared to untreated rCFs, due to improved molecular chain entanglement. FE-SEM, FT-IR, and XPS analyses confirmed the formation of a siloxane network on the rCF surface, enhancing composite properties.
population_specificity: Recycled carbon fibers (rCFs) and polypropylene composites.
effective_dosage: Different amounts of silane (specific quantities not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety, efficacy, and limitations of carbon fiber-reinforced polyetheretherketone (CFR-PEEK) spine implants compared to titanium implants for postoperative imaging and radiation planning in spine tumor patients.
results_summary: The study found that CFR-PEEK implants reduce imaging artifacts on CT and MRI scans compared to titanium, enabling more accurate postoperative radiation planning and disease recurrence detection. However, the abstract does not provide detailed efficacy data or comparative outcomes.
population_specificity: Patients with spine tumors undergoing surgical resection and stabilization.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of dietary fiber supplementation on uremic toxins and inflammatory markers in individuals with chronic kidney disease (CKD).
results_summary: Dietary fiber supplementation significantly reduced serum uremic toxins (p-cresyl sulfate, indoxyl sulfate, blood urea nitrogen) and inflammatory markers (interleukin-6, tumor necrosis factor alpha) in CKD patients, but did not affect trimethylamine N-oxide, uric acid, or high-sensitivity C-reactive protein levels.
population_specificity: Individuals with chronic kidney disease (CKD), with or without dialysis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether fiber supplementation alters lipopolysaccharide-binding protein (LBP) concentrations and lecithin cholesterol acyltransferase activity, markers of intestinal permeability and HDL function.
results_summary: Fiber supplementation did not significantly alter LBP or lecithin cholesterol acyltransferase activity overall but reduced LBP in a subgroup with elevated baseline levels. Exploratory analyses identified correlations between microbial genes, LBP, and environmental factors like industrial chemicals and medications.
population_specificity: 20 healthy, young participants consuming a low-fiber diet at baseline.
study_duration: 4 weeks per intervention arm with a 4-week washout.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of chitosan pretreatment on the push-out bond strength of fiber posts cemented with self-adhesive resin cement in root dentin.
results_summary: Pretreatment with 2.5% chitosan significantly improved push-out bond strength compared to the control group across all root regions, while 1% chitosan and 17% EDTA did not show significant improvements. Cohesive failure was dominant in the 2.5% chitosan group, whereas mixed failure was more common in other groups.
population_specificity: Maxillary central incisors that underwent endodontic treatment.
study_duration: Not specified (thermocycling was performed for 5,000 cycles).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of chemical treatment (NaOH) on natural fibers (AM and BV) and their incorporation into PLA matrix to enhance mechanical properties like tensile strength and flexural strength.
results_summary: Chemical treatment (3 wt% NaOH) improved tensile strength in AM (163.4 to 186.5 MPa) and BV (173.1 to 199.5 MPa) fibers, but higher concentrations (5 wt%) degraded properties. Adding AM to PLA reduced tensile strength, while VWP improved flexural strength up to 4 wt%.
population_specificity: Not specified (laboratory study on fibers and composites).
effective_dosage: 3-8 wt% NaOH for fiber treatment; 20 wt% AM in PLA; 4 wt% VWP in hybrid composites.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of a 12-month synbiotic supplementation on bone and metabolic health in postmenopausal women, focusing on bone mineral density and blood glucose regulation.
results_summary: The abstract describes the study design but does not report results, as it appears to be a rationale and design paper for an ongoing trial.
population_specificity: 160 Caucasian, postmenopausal women without osteoporosis or current pro-/prebiotic supplementation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effect of soluble fiber on triglycerides, total cholesterol, LDL-C, and HDL-C in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM).
results_summary: Soluble fiber significantly reduced triglycerides (-16.97 mg/dL), LDL-C (-11.14 mg/dL), and total cholesterol (-13.87 mg/dL), while increasing HDL-C (1.74 mg/dL). The findings suggest soluble fiber supplementation can improve lipid profiles in T2DM patients.
population_specificity: Patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of dietary fiber in generating gut microbiota-derived short-chain fatty acids (SCFAs) and its potential impact on hypertension and cardiovascular outcomes.
results_summary: The study highlights that dietary fiber intake influences the generation of SCFAs, which may play a role in hypertension management and cardiovascular prevention, though specific effects on blood pressure are not detailed.
population_specificity: Patients with hypertension (general mention, no specific subgroup details).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify dietary components, including fiber, that have protective effects against non-communicable chronic liver diseases.
results_summary: The study found that dietary fiber, among other nutrients, has liver-protective effects, contributing to anti-inflammatory and anti-cancer benefits. It recommends a diet rich in these components for liver disease prevention.
population_specificity: General population at risk of non-communicable chronic liver diseases (e.g., those with poor diet, obesity, or type 2 diabetes).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and costs of recruitment strategies for a clinical trial testing the 1-year effect of corn soluble fiber supplementation on bone mass in healthy children.
results_summary: The study found that "Online" recruitment strategies were more effective and cost-efficient than "Traditional" methods, with the most successful strategies involving university-related outreach. The main reasons for ineligibility were obesity and age range.
population_specificity: Healthy children aged 9-14 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the long-term benefits of dietary fiber supplementation on body composition, glucose-lipid metabolism, and diabetes incidence in middle-aged and elderly patients with prediabetes.
results_summary: After 6 months, the intervention group showed significant reductions in waist circumference, waist-to-hip ratio, fasting plasma glucose, 2-hour plasma glucose, and postprandial insulin levels compared to baseline. After 12 months, blood glucose levels and diabetes incidence remained lower in the intervention group than in the control group.
population_specificity: Middle-aged and elderly patients with prediabetes.
effective_dosage: 15 g of mixed fiber per serving, consumed daily before meals.
study_duration: 6 months of intervention, with a 1-year follow-up.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the neurological and gastroenterological effects of a synbiotic product (containing prebiotic fiber inulin) on behavioral and cognitive symptoms in Parkinson's Disease patients with constipation.
results_summary: The study found significant improvements in neurological and gastroenterological evaluations, including better scores in MDS-UPDRS part 1, SCOPA-AUT, and PAC-SYM, as well as increased abundance of beneficial gut bacteria like Faecalibacterium prausnitzii.
population_specificity: Patients with stable Parkinson's Disease who met diagnostic criteria for functional constipation and/or irritable bowel syndrome with constipation (Rome IV Criteria).
effective_dosage: Not specified (synbiotic product Enterolactis Duo contained prebiotic fiber inulin).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether altering microbiota composition via antibiotic treatment or a high-fiber diet affects short-chain fatty acid (SCFA) signaling in the rat caecum.
results_summary: A high-fiber diet increased acetate concentration but reduced propionate and butyrate in the caecum, nearly doubling propionate-induced anion secretion. These effects were not linked to changes in FFA2 receptor expression or Ca2+ signaling but may involve altered cholinergic signaling.
population_specificity: Rats (animal model)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of carbohydrate supplementation on muscle metabolism and performance during short-duration high-intensity intermittent exercise.
results_summary: The study compared carbohydrate (CHO) and placebo (PLA) supplementation during high-intensity intermittent cycling but did not explicitly report Fiber's effects in the provided abstract.
population_specificity: Eleven moderately-to-well-trained males

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the influence of dietary patterns, including high-fiber foods, on hepatic epigenetic gene modulation for NAFLD prevention and management.
results_summary: The study found that increasing consumption of high-fiber foods is beneficial for preventing and managing NAFLD, as part of a broader dietary intervention strategy. It highlighted fiber's role in influencing epigenetic changes linked to metabolic health.
population_specificity: General population, with a focus on NAFLD patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a nano-fiber/net artificial bionic dura mater (NABDM) could reduce neuroinflammation, promote neural stem cell differentiation, and improve functional recovery after spinal cord injury.
results_summary: The NABDM modified microglia polarization, accelerated neural stem cell differentiation via cGMP-PKG and cAMP pathways, reduced neuroinflammation, increased mature neurons, and improved motor, sensory, and autonomic nerve function in mice with spinal cord injury.
population_specificity: Mice with spinal cord injury.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the feasibility of gut flora, including dietary fiber, as a novel biomarker for hypertensive disorders of pregnancy (HDP) and to provide new strategies for its prevention and treatment.
results_summary: The study suggests that dysregulated gut flora may contribute to HDP and that supplementation with dietary fiber and probiotics could potentially intervene in this process, though specific efficacy data on fiber alone are not detailed.
population_specificity: Pregnant women at risk for or diagnosed with hypertensive disorders of pregnancy (HDP).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the potential of short-chain fatty acids (SCFAs) derived from dietary fiber fermentation to improve bone health and prevent osteoporosis.
results_summary: Preclinical studies showed that SCFAs like butyrate and propionate prevent bone loss by inhibiting osteoclastogenesis and modulating immunity. Early clinical data suggest SCFA supplementation may improve bone turnover markers in postmenopausal women.
population_specificity: Postmenopausal women (clinical data) and preclinical osteoporosis models.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of AI-guided dietary supplement prescriptions versus physician-guided prescriptions in reducing LDL-C levels and other cardiovascular risk markers.
results_summary: The AI-guided group showed a significantly greater reduction in LDL-C levels (25.3%) compared to the physician-guided group (15.2%). Secondary endpoints, including changes in total cholesterol, HDL-C, triglycerides, and hsCRP, were also monitored, though specific results were not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: 70 patients aged 40-75 years with LDL-C levels between 70 and 190 mg/dL.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize recent findings on the health impacts of microbial metabolites derived from dietary fiber, beyond SCFAs, and discuss personalized approaches to fiber supplementation.
results_summary: The study highlights that fiber degradation by gut microbes produces beneficial metabolites like secondary bile acids, aromatic amino acid derivatives, neurotransmitters, and B vitamins, which influence host health. It emphasizes the need for personalized fiber recommendations based on microbiome functionality.
population_specificity: General human population, with mentions of maternal dietary fiber intake and agricultural practices.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to understand the factors determining inter-individual differences in gastrointestinal (GI) symptoms caused by higher doses of fiber supplements, specifically corn bran arabinoxylan (AX).
results_summary: The study found that higher doses of fiber supplements cause varying GI symptoms among individuals, but the underlying reasons for these differences remain insufficiently understood.
population_specificity: Not specified in the abstract.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the health benefits, pharmaceutical applications, and production processes of Konjac glucomannan (KG) as a dietary fiber.
results_summary: KG was found to reduce glucose, cholesterol, triglyceride levels, and blood pressure, offering weight loss benefits. It also demonstrated prebiotic, anti-inflammatory, and antitumor activities.
population_specificity: Not specified (general health-conscious populations in Asian and European markets).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of zinc, not fiber, in modulating immune responses and its potential effects on allergic diseases.
results_summary: The abstract discusses zinc deficiency's link to allergic diseases and suggests zinc supplementation may positively influence immune modulation and reduce allergic symptoms, but does not mention fiber.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion on allergic diseases).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether fecal microbial transplantation (FMT) followed by dietary fiber supplements improved glucose homeostasis in adults with obesity and metabolic syndrome.
results_summary: The study found that FMT combined with fiber supplements improved glucose homeostasis, as measured by HOMA-IR responders, suggesting a potential benefit for metabolic health. The effect was observed in participants grouped by donor compatibility.
population_specificity: Adults with obesity and metabolic syndrome.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the influence of dietary fiber, from food sources and soluble fiber supplementation, on metabolic health and pregnancy outcomes in women at high risk of Metabolic Syndrome.
results_summary: Insufficient dietary fiber intake was linked to increased risk of gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM), while high total fiber intake reduced triglyceride level changes. Soluble fiber supplementation showed potential benefits for GDM patients and reduced constipation medication needs, with no safety concerns noted.
population_specificity: 376 pregnant women between 11 and 13 weeks of gestation at high risk of Metabolic Syndrome.
effective_dosage: Daily soluble fiber supplements (specific amount not stated).
study_duration: From 11-13 weeks of gestation until delivery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of partially hydrolyzed guar gum (PHGG), a water-soluble prebiotic dietary fiber, on cognitive function, sleep quality, and mood in healthy elderly individuals.
results_summary: PHGG supplementation significantly improved visual memory and sleep quality, with no significant effects on mood parameters. Vigor-activity scores increased, and Confusion-Bewilderment scores decreased in the PHGG group compared to baseline.
population_specificity: Healthy elderly individuals

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of dietary modifications, including fiber-rich diets like Mediterranean and DASH, on chronic diseases such as cardiovascular disease, hypertension, and diabetes.
results_summary: The study found that whole-food, plant-based diets, including those high in fiber, resulted in reduced body weight, lower A1c levels, and decreased insulin resistance in diabetic patients. It also supported heart-healthy diets like DASH for managing hypertension and diabetes.
population_specificity: Patients with cardiovascular disease, hypertension, diabetes, or at risk of diabetes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of a 4-week intervention with Acacia fiber (AF) or probiotic Bifidobacterium Lactis (BLa80) on stool pattern, IBS symptoms, and Quality of Life in individuals with IBS-C.
results_summary: Stool frequency significantly improved with AF and BLa80 compared to placebo. BLa80 reduced IBS symptom severity, while AF showed a trend toward decreased constipation symptoms. No significant changes were observed in stool consistency, stool mass, or QoL measures.
population_specificity: 180 subjects meeting ROME IV criteria for IBS-C.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether starch degradation products (SDexF) as prebiotics could effectively manage obesity in mice and overweight/obese children by influencing gut microbiota and metabolic outcomes.
results_summary: SDexF slowed weight gain in female mice but had only temporary effects in males, with no significant impact on weight loss or gut microbiota composition in overweight/obese children. The anti-obesity effect observed in mice was not replicated in humans.
population_specificity: Mice on normal and Western diets, and overweight/obese children.
effective_dosage: 5% SDexF in mice, 10 g SDexF in children (added to fruit and vegetable mousse).
study_duration: 28 weeks in mice, 24 weeks in children.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the pharmacological activities and health benefits of millets, focusing on their bioactive compounds and potential therapeutic effects.
results_summary: Millets demonstrated antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, anti-carcinogenic, hypolipidemic, hypoglycemic, antimicrobial, and immunomodulatory properties, suggesting broad health benefits. Their high dietary fiber and resistant starch content were particularly noted for regulating blood lipids and glucose, reducing cardiovascular risk.
population_specificity: Not specified (general health benefits implied).
